org.jruyi.io

Interface ICodec<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the data object to be encoded/decoded
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCodec

    public interface ICodec<T>
    A codec is used to encode/decode data to/from a chain of buffer units.
    See Also:
    Codec

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get(IUnitChain unitChain, int index)
      Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain starting at the specified index in the current unit and returns the resultant object.
      T get(IUnitChain unitChain, int index, int length)
      Decodes the specified length of bytes from the specified unitChain starting at the specified index to an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
      void get(T dst, int offset, int length, IUnitChain unitChain, int index)
      Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain starting at the specified index to the specified collection dst from the (inclusive) element at the specified offset to the (exclusive) element at (offset + length).
      void get(T dst, IUnitChain unitChain, int index)
      Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain starting at the specified index to the specified dst.
      void prepend(T src, int offset, int length, IUnitChain unitChain)
      Encodes the specified length of elements in the specified collection src starting at offset, and writes the resultant bytes to the head of the specified unitChain.
      void prepend(T src, IUnitChain unitChain)
      Encodes the specified src and writes the resultant bytes to the head of the specified unitChain.
      T read(IUnitChain unitChain)
      Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain, starting at position in the current unit, to an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
      T read(IUnitChain unitChain, int length)
      Decodes the specified length of bytes from the specified unitChain, starting at position in the current unit, to an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
      int read(T dst, int offset, int length, IUnitChain unitChain)
      Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain, starting at position in the current unit, to the specified collection dst from the (inclusive) element at the specified offset to the (exclusive) element at (offset + length).
      int read(T dst, IUnitChain unitChain)
      Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain, starting at position in the current unit, to the specified dst and returns the actual number of bytes decoded.
      void set(T src, int offset, int length, IUnitChain unitChain, int index)
      Encodes the specified length of elements in the specified collection src starting at the specified offset and sets the resultant bytes to the specified unitChain starting at index.
      void set(T src, IUnitChain unitChain, int index)
      Encodes the specified src and sets the resultant bytes to the specified unitChain starting at the specified index.
      void write(T src, int offset, int length, IUnitChain unitChain)
      Encodes the specified length of elements in the specified collection src starting at offset, and writes the resultant bytes to the end of the specified unitChain.
      void write(T src, IUnitChain unitChain)
      Encodes the specified src and writes the resultant bytes to the end of the specified unitChain.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        T read(IUnitChain unitChain)
        Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain, starting at position in the current unit, to an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
        Parameters:
        unitChain - the bytes from which to be decoded
        Returns:
        the decoded object
        Throws:
        BufferUnderflowException - if there's not enough data remaining in the unitChain

      • read

        T read(IUnitChain unitChain,
     int length)
        Decodes the specified length of bytes from the specified unitChain, starting at position in the current unit, to an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
        Parameters:
        unitChain - the bytes from which to be decoded
        length - the number of bytes to be decoded
        Returns:
        the resultant object
        Throws:
        BufferUnderflowException - if there's not enough data remaining in the unitChain

      • read

        int read(T dst,
       IUnitChain unitChain)
        Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain, starting at position in the current unit, to the specified dst and returns the actual number of bytes decoded.
        Parameters:
        dst - the object to hold the decoded result
        unitChain - the bytes from which to be decoded
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes decoded

      • read

        int read(T dst,
       int offset,
       int length,
       IUnitChain unitChain)
        Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain, starting at position in the current unit, to the specified collection dst from the (inclusive) element at the specified offset to the (exclusive) element at (offset + length).
        Parameters:
        dst - the collection to hold the decoded elements
        offset - the offset of the first decoded element in unitChain
        length - the number of decoded elements
        unitChain - the bytes from which to be decoded
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes decoded
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset or length doesn't hold the condition

      • write

        void write(T src,
         IUnitChain unitChain)
        Encodes the specified src and writes the resultant bytes to the end of the specified unitChain.
        Parameters:
        src - the object to be encoded
        unitChain - the unit chain where the encoded bytes to be written to

      • write

        void write(T src,
         int offset,
         int length,
         IUnitChain unitChain)
        Encodes the specified length of elements in the specified collection src starting at offset, and writes the resultant bytes to the end of the specified unitChain.
        Parameters:
        src - the collection to be encoded
        offset - the index of the first element in src to be encoded
        length - the number of elements to be encoded
        unitChain - the unit chain where the encoded bytes to be written to

      • get

        T get(IUnitChain unitChain,
    int index)
        Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain starting at the specified index in the current unit and returns the resultant object.
        Parameters:
        unitChain - the bytes from which to be decoded
        index - the offset of the first byte in the current unit to be decoded
        Returns:
        the decoded object
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bounds

      • get

        T get(IUnitChain unitChain,
    int index,
    int length)
        Decodes the specified length of bytes from the specified unitChain starting at the specified index to an object of type T and returns the resultant object.
        Parameters:
        unitChain - the bytes from which to be decoded
        index - the offset of the first byte to be decoded
        length - the number of bytes to be decoded
        Returns:
        the resultant object
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index or length does not hold the condition

      • get

        void get(T dst,
       IUnitChain unitChain,
       int index)
        Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain starting at the specified index to the specified dst.
        Parameters:
        dst - the object to hold the decoded result
        unitChain - the bytes from which to be decoded
        index - the offset of the first byte to be decoded
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bounds

      • get

        void get(T dst,
       int offset,
       int length,
       IUnitChain unitChain,
       int index)
        Decodes the bytes from the specified unitChain starting at the specified index to the specified collection dst from the (inclusive) element at the specified offset to the (exclusive) element at (offset + length).
        Parameters:
        dst - the collection to hold the decoded elements
        offset - the offset of the first decoded element in unitChain
        length - the number of decoded elements
        unitChain - the bytes from which to be decoded
        index - the offset of the first byte to be decoded
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset or length does not hold the condition, or index is out of bounds

      • set

        void set(T src,
       IUnitChain unitChain,
       int index)
        Encodes the specified src and sets the resultant bytes to the specified unitChain starting at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        src - the object to be encoded
        unitChain - the unit chain where the encoded bytes to be set to
        index - the offset of the first byte in the current unit to be set
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bounds

      • set

        void set(T src,
       int offset,
       int length,
       IUnitChain unitChain,
       int index)
        Encodes the specified length of elements in the specified collection src starting at the specified offset and sets the resultant bytes to the specified unitChain starting at index.
        Parameters:
        src - the collection whose elements to be encoded
        offset - the index of the first element in the src to be encoded
        length - the number of elements in the src to be encoded
        unitChain - the unit chain where the encoded bytes to be set to
        index - the offset of the first byte in the current unit to be set

      • prepend

        void prepend(T src,
           IUnitChain unitChain)
        Encodes the specified src and writes the resultant bytes to the head of the specified unitChain.
        Parameters:
        src - the object to be encoded
        unitChain - the unit chain where the encoded bytes to be prepended to

      • prepend

        void prepend(T src,
           int offset,
           int length,
           IUnitChain unitChain)
        Encodes the specified length of elements in the specified collection src starting at offset, and writes the resultant bytes to the head of the specified unitChain.
        Parameters:
        src - the collection to be encoded
        offset - the index of the first element in the specified src to be encoded
        length - the number of elements to be encoded
        unitChain - the unit chain where the encoded bytes to be prepended to
